content.question: As otters were removed during the hunting years, there was a large decrease in the catches of fish species from the eelgrass habitats. Which of the following best explains why this decrease happened?

choices.label: Otters are a keystone species, so their disappearance from the area affected the population size of one other species.
Otters are a keystone species, so their disappearance from the area resulted in the collapse of an entire community.
Otters have mutualistic relationships with many other species, so their disappearance from the area affected the population size of another species.
Otters have mutualistic relationships with many other species, so their disappearance from the area resulted in the collapse of an entire ecosystem.

content.answer: Otters are a keystone species, so their disappearance from the area resulted in the collapse of an entire community.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
